Condition.Diagnostic: Require: Middleware:FILEX:Core:* AND one of the LEVELX NOR interfaces
Require: Middleware:FILEX:Core:* AND one of the LEVELX NAND interfaces
Available only if FREERTOS is disabled

RefParameter.Name: FX_DISABLE_DIRECT_DATA_READ_CACHE_FILL
RefParameter.Description: Direct read sector cache will be disabled if cache is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_DISABLE_ERROR_CHECKING
RefParameter.Description: Removes the basic FileX error checking API and results in improved performance (as much as 30%) and smaller code size.

RefParameter.Name: FX_DONT_UPDATE_OPEN_FILES
RefParameter.Description: Defined, FileX does not update already opened files

RefParameter.Name: FX_DONT_UPDATE_OPEN_FILES
RefParameter.Description: Defined, FileX does not update already opened files

RefParameter.Name: FX_ENABLE_EXFAT
RefParameter.Description: Defined, FileX is able to access exFAT file system.

RefParameter.Name: FX_ENABLE_FAULT_TOLERANT
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables FileX fault tolerant service.

RefParameter.Name: FX_FAT_MAP_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of sectors that can be represented in the FAT update map. The default value is 256, but this can be overridden with a command-line define. Larger values help reduce unneeded updates of secondary FAT sectors.

RefParameter.Name: FX_FAULT_TOLERANT
RefParameter.Description: Defined, system sector write requests (including FAT and directory entry requests) are flushed immediately to the driver.

RefParameter.Name: FX_FAULT_TOLERANT_BOOT_INDEX
RefParameter.Description: Define byte offset in boot sector where the cluster number of the Fault Tolerant Log file is.

RefParameter.Name: FX_FAULT_TOLERANT_DATA
RefParameter.Description: Defined, data sector write requests are flushed immediately to the driver.

RefParameter.Name: FX_MAX_FAT_CACHE
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the number of entries in the internal FAT cache. The default value is 16, but this can be overridden with a command-line define. All values must be a power of 2.

RefParameter.Name: FX_MAX_LAST_NAME_LEN
RefParameter.Description: This value defines the maximum file name length, which includes full path name. FX_MAX_LAST_NAME_LEN must be as large or larger than FX_MAX_LONG_NAME_LEN

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: The value of FX_MAX_LAST_NAME_LEN must be greater or equal to FX_MAX_LONG_NAME_LEN

RefParameter.Name: FX_MAX_LONG_NAME_LEN
RefParameter.Description: Defines the maximum size of long file names supported by FileX.

RefParameter.Name: FX_MAX_SECTOR_CACHE
RefParameter.Description: Defines the maximum number of logical sectors that can be cached by FileX. The cache memory supplied to FileX at fx_media_open determines how many sectors can actually be cached The FX_MAX_SECTOR_CACHE is 2 to the power of MAX_SECTOR_CACHE_NB_BIT.

RefParameter.Name: FX_MEDIA_DISABLE_SEARCH_CACHE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, the file search cache optimization is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_MEDIA_STATISTICS_DISABLE
RefParameter.Description: Defined, gathering of media statistics is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_NO_LOCAL_PATH
RefParameter.Description: Defined, local path logic is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_NO_LOCAL_PATH
RefParameter.Description: Defined, local path logic is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_NO_TIMER
RefParameter.Description: Eliminates the ThreadX timer setup to update the FileX system time and date. Doing so causes default time and date to be placed on all file operations.

RefParameter.Name: FX_NO_TIMER
RefParameter.Description: Eliminates the ThreadX timer setup to update the FileX system time and date. Doing so causes default time and date to be placed on all file operations.

RefParameter.Name: FX_RENAME_PATH_INHERIT
RefParameter.Description: Defined, renaming inherits path information.

RefParameter.Name: FX_SINGLE_OPEN_LEGACY
RefParameter.Description: Defined, legacy single open logic for the same file is enabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_SINGLE_THREAD
RefParameter.Description: Eliminates ThreadX protection logic from the FileX source. It should be used if FileX is being used only from one thread or if FileX is being used without ThreadX.

RefParameter.Name: FX_SINGLE_THREAD
RefParameter.Description: Eliminates ThreadX protection logic from the FileX source. It should be used if FileX is being used only from one thread or if FileX is being used without ThreadX.

RefParameter.Name: FX_UPDATE_RATE_IN_SECONDS
RefParameter.Description: Defines the number of seconds the time parameters are updated in FileX.

RefParameter.Name: FX_UPDATE_RATE_IN_TICKS
RefParameter.Description: Defines the number of ThreadX timer ticks required to achieve the update rate. That is, the update rate, but in ticks.

RefParameter.Name: FileX_Version
RefParameter.Description: FileX version

RefParameter.Name: MAX_FAT_CACHE_NB_BIT
RefParameter.Description: Represents the power of which FX_MAX_FAT_CACHE is rised to

RefParameter.Name: MAX_SECTOR_CACHE_NB_BIT
RefParameter.Description: represents the power of which FX_MAX_SECTOR_CACHE is rised to

RefParameter.Name: FX_DRIVER_USE_64BIT_LBA
RefParameter.Description: Defined, enables 64-bits sector addresses used in I/O driver.

RefParameter.Name: FX_SRAM_BASE_ADDRESS_RANGES
RefParameter.Description: define the address range from which the SRAM file system will be created

RefParameter.Name: FX_SRAM_BASE_ADDRESS_RANGES
RefParameter.Description: define the address range from which the SRAM file system will be created

RefParameter.Name: FX_SRAM_BASE_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: define the address from which the SRAM file system will be created

RefParameter.Name: FX_SRAM_BASE_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: define the address from which the SRAM file system will be created

RefParameter.Name: FX_SRAM_BASE_ADDRESS
RefParameter.Description: define the address from which the SRAM file system will be created

RefParameter.Name: SRAM_DISK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: define the SRAM file system disk size: 256K

RefParameter.Name: SRAM_DISK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: define the SRAM file system disk size: 64K

RefParameter.Name: SRAM_DISK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: define the SRAM file system disk size: 320K

RefParameter.Name: SD_SECTOR_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: define the default sector size, needed by the fx_media_format() API.

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: the sector size should be multiple of 32.

RefParameter.Name: ENABLE_CACHE_MAINTENANCE
RefParameter.Description: When using cachable memory region, it is recommended to maintain the data cache to always ensure data integrity between CPU and SD DMA operations.

RefParameter.Name: SDMMC_INSTANCE
RefParameter.Description: define the default SD instance to use.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Available only when SDMMC1 is activated in SD mode. If trust zone is enabled SDMMC1 must be activated in non secure context.
Available only when SDMMC2 is activated in SD mode. If trust zone is enabled SDMMC2 must be activated in non secure context.

RefParameter.Comment: FX Driver Initializes the SD IP
RefParameter.Name: FX_DRIVER_SDMMC_INIT
RefParameter.Description: by default, the FX SD driver initializes the SD IP, set this flag to false to let the application do the init.

RefParameter.Name: MMC_SECTOR_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: define the default sector size, needed by the fx_media_format() API.

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: the sector size should be multiple of 32.

RefParameter.Name: MMC_ENABLE_CACHE_MAINTENANCE
RefParameter.Description: When using cachable memory region, it is recommended to maintain the data cache to always ensure data integrity between CPU and SD DMA operations.

RefParameter.Name: MMC_INSTANCE
RefParameter.Description: define the default SD instance to use.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Available only when SDMMC1 is activated in MMC mode. If trust zone is enabled SDMMC1 must be activated in non secure context.
Available only when SDMMC2 is activated in MMC mode. If trust zone is enabled SDMMC2 must be activated in non secure context.

RefParameter.Comment: FX Driver Initializes the MMC IP
RefParameter.Name: FX_DRIVER_MMC_INIT
RefParameter.Description: by default, the FX SDMMC driver initializes the SDMMC IP, set this flag to false to let the application do the init.

Condition.Expression: (( SDMMC1_Bus1Bit | SDMMC1_Bus4Bits | SDMMC1_Bus8Bits) & MMC_INSTANCE=0) | ( (SDMMC2_Bus1Bit | SDMMC2_Bus4Bits | SDMMC2_Bus8Bits) & MMC_INSTANCE=1)

((((SDMMC1_Bus1Bit | SDMMC1_Bus4Bits | SDMMC1_Bus8Bits) & MMC_INSTANCE=0) | ((SDMMC2_Bus1Bit | SDMMC2_Bus4Bits | SDMMC2_Bus8Bits) & MMC_INSTANCE=1)) & MMC_GLUE_FUNCTIONS=DMA_API & SEMThreadXCcRTOSJjThreadXJjCore)

((((SDMMC1_Bus1Bit | SDMMC1_Bus4Bits | SDMMC1_Bus8Bits)& MMC_INSTANCE=0) | ((SDMMC2_Bus1Bit | SDMMC2_Bus4Bits | SDMMC2_Bus8Bits) & MMC_INSTANCE=1)) & MMC_GLUE_FUNCTIONS=DMA_API & !SEMThreadXCcRTOSJjThreadXJjCore)

RefParameter.Name: ULONG_64_DEFINED
RefParameter.Description: the default value of the ULONG64 type

RefParameter.Name: ULONG_64_DEFINED
RefParameter.Description: the default value of the ULONG64 type

RefParameter.Name: FX_LX_NOR_CUSTOM_DRIVER_NAME
RefParameter.Description: define the NOR custom driver name.

RefParameter.Name: FX_LX_NOR_CUSTOM_DRIVER_ID
RefParameter.Description:
Define the NOR custom driver id.
The value of FX_LX_NOR_CUSTOM_DRIVER_ID should not take the value of the UNKNOWN_DRIVER_ID that is 0xFFFFFFFF

RefParameter.Name: FX_LX_NOR_CUSTOM_DRIVER_INIT
RefParameter.Description: define the NOR custom driver initialization function.

RefParameter.Name: FX_LX_NAND_CUSTOM_DRIVER_NAME
RefParameter.Description: define the NAND custom driver name.

RefParameter.Name: FX_LX_NAND_CUSTOM_DRIVER_ID
RefParameter.Description:
define the NAND custom driver id.
The value of FX_LX_NAND_CUSTOM_DRIVER_ID should not take the value of the UNKNOWN_DRIVER_ID that is 0xFFFFFFFF

RefParameter.Name: FX_LX_NAND_CUSTOM_DRIVER_INIT
RefParameter.Description: define the NAND custom driver initialization function.

RefParameter.Name: FX_APP_MEM_POOL_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Default memory pool size for the FileX application.

RefParameter.Name: FX_STANDALONE_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: Configure the FileX in Standalone mode.

RefParameter.Name: FX_STANDALONE_ENABLE
RefParameter.Description: Configure the FileX in Standalone mode.

RefParameter.Name: FX_DISABLE_CACHE
RefParameter.Description: Determine if cache is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_DISABLE_FILE_CLOSE
RefParameter.Description: If defined, file close is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_DISABLE_FAST_OPEN
RefParameter.Description: If defined, fast open is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_DISABLE_FORCE_MEMORY_OPERATION
RefParameter.Description: If defined, force memory operations are disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_DISABLE_BUILD_OPTIONS
RefParameter.Description: If defined, build options is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_DISABLE_ONE_LINE_FUNCTION
RefParameter.Description: If defined, one line function is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_DISABLE_FAT_ENTRY_REFRESH
RefParameter.Description: If defined, FAT entry refresh is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_DISABLE_CONSECUTIVE_DETECT
RefParameter.Description: If defined, consecutive detect is disabled.

RefParameter.Name: FX_EXFAT_MAX_CACHE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Define bitmap cache size for exFAT. Size should be minimum one sector size and maximum 4096. For applications using multiple media devices with varying sector size, the value should be set to the size of largest sector size. The FX_EXFAT_MAX_CACHE_SIZE is 2 power of FX_EXFAT_MAX_CACHE_SIZE_NB_BIT.

RefParameter.Name: FX_FAULT_TOLERANT_CACHE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Define the size of fault tolerant cache, which is used when freeing FAT chain. The FX_FAULT_TOLERANT_CACHE_SIZE is 2 power of FX_FAULT_TOLERANT_CACHE_SIZE_NB_SIZE.

RefParameter.Name: FX_FAULT_TOLERANT_CACHE_SIZE_NB_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Represents the exponent power of which FX_FAULT_TOLERANT_CACHE_SIZE is rised to.

RefParameter.Name: FX_EXFAT_MAX_CACHE_SIZE_NB_BIT
RefParameter.Description: Represents the exponent power of which FX_EXFAT_MAX_CACHE_SIZE is rised to.

RefParameter.Name: FILEX_MEM_POOL_VAR_NAME
RefParameter.Description:
Default FileX memory pool var name
This is a variable name. It should be C compliant declaration, Otherwise compilation errors will be generated in the project.

RefParameter.Name: GENERATE_FILEX_INIT_CODE
RefParameter.Description: Generate application code to initialize the FileX/LevelX stack in MX_FileX_Init() function.

RefParameter.Name: FILEX_APPLICATION_THREAD_ENTRY_NAME
RefParameter.Description: Main thread entry function Name.

RefParameter.Name: FILEX_APPLICATION_THREAD_PRIORITY
RefParameter.Description: FileX Application Thread Priority value for FileX application.

RefParameter.Name: FILEX_APPLICATION_THREAD_STACK_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Thread stack size value for FileX application.

ValueCondition.Diagnostic: Stack size shall not exceed FileX mem pool size

RefParameter.Name: LINK_SRAM_DRIVER
RefParameter.Description: Generates fx_media_open() function call to link the SRAM Driver to the application.

RefParameter.Name: FORMAT_SRAM_MEDIA
RefParameter.Description: Generates fx_media_format() function call to format the SRAM Media.

RefParameter.Name: LINK_SD_DRIVER
RefParameter.Description: Generates fx_media_open() function call to link the SD Driver to the application.

RefParameter.Name: FORMAT_SD_MEDIA
RefParameter.Description: Generates fx_media_format() function call to format the SD Media.

RefParameter.Name: LINK_MMC_DRIVER
RefParameter.Description: Generates fx_media_open() function call to link the MMC Driver to the application.

RefParameter.Name: FORMAT_MMC_MEDIA
RefParameter.Description: Generates fx_media_format() function call to format the MMC Media.

RefParameter.Name: LINK_NOR_OSPI_DRIVER
RefParameter.Description: Generates fx_media_open() function call to link the NOR OSPI Driver to the application.

RefParameter.Name: FORMAT_NOR_OSPI_MEDIA
RefParameter.Description: Generates fx_media_open() function call to link the NOR OSPI Driver to the application.

RefParameter.Name: LINK_NOR_SIMULATOR_DRIVER
RefParameter.Description: Generates fx_media_open() function call to link the NOR SIMULATOR Driver to the application.

RefParameter.Name: FORMAT_NOR_SIMULATOR_MEDIA
RefParameter.Description: Generates fx_media_format() function call to format the NOR SIMULATOR Media.
